reviews.sentence: Very nice hotel. This is a very nice hotel. Only had a couple of negative experiences which is why I did not give it a 5 star. The room was great and quite comfortable. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The negatives are that on my first night I ordered room service and it never came. After a hour and half I called down and it appeared that my order was never entered into the system or that it got lost. The next night around 9 pm I was contacted bu room service to see if I was interested in dinner on themWas a little to late to be offered a free dinner. The only other negative I had was that my shower on the first morning there was barely luke warm. I realize the hotel was busy but it there is nothing more than I hate than a not hot shower in the morning. I hold nothing against this property and would definitely stay there again and I recommend this hotel.

4 Star Hotel 25 Star Amenities. The lobby is gorgeous I will admit. My husband and I booked on Hotwire. perhaps that was our mistake. The furniture in the room was well worn and the walls were THIN. We were woken up by people on both sides of us. The beds were not the comfiest but the pillows were nice. The shower had two settings warm and trickling or hot and blasting. The staff was friendly no problem. Again we booked on Hotwire so perhaps that was why our room was not that great. But I would not stay here again. I had rather book direct and pay the same price for a Choice Hotel.

Ok as a Holiday Inn but not as a Hyat. Hyat is a good brand. Lots of money invested in it. Therefore I am puzzled as to why would they drop the ball on the product quality in this location. The public spaces are well done. Fairly typical Hyat décor. Front desk service was efficient no complaints. The room however was a different story. The physical layout and original construction simply do not support an upscale property. Walls are paper thin and you can hear conversations in the adjoining rooms and even across the hall without straining. After arrival I got to listen to a detailed sales report from a gentleman across the hall. It was mildly amusing for about 5 minutes. The furnishings were ok but the bathroom was small with the shower in tub set up and cheap fixtures. The television was an old version poor resolution flat screen. All of this would be acceptable for a Holiday Inn market segment. As a Hyat it simply does not fly. wifi was free with an attempt at premium upsel and the sheets are changed every 2 days because of the overwhelming concern for the environment by the management. these little cards with environmental concerns which save money for the hotel but do nothing for the traveller always amuse me. This hotel clearly caters to school groups. I counted at least 6. The use of the lobby and the elevators can get pretty challenging. The noise levels generated by school groups gets to be particularly challenging in a hotel with poor sound insulation. Food at the bar was decent and prices were reasonable. Breakfast buffet was a low quality affair designed to satisfy the student groups. Again not exactly up to the Hyat level. Service staff at breakfast ran the place as a busy packed diner. Lots of noise and instructions. There was nothing terrible about the property and everything was reasonably efficient but this is not what one expects when one stays at the Hyat.

Worst Hotel Stay. The Hyat Fairfax is the worst hotel experience we have ever had. First we had to pay an additional 25 for early check in. We were also told that incidental charges were 40 did not mention per night. When I called to check my credit card I discovered that the hotel had charged 193. The next day were out all day. Upon our return we found the room the same as we had left it. When I called the front desk I was told that the room would be cleaned if I prefer. This is the first and last time we will ever stay at a Hyat Hotel.
Worse hotel experience. The room had mold smell and the towels smells bad the hotel looks very bad.

staff was awful. We had not been to the DC area before and put some level of trust in that staff to provide us with needed information to make our stay enjoyable and hassle free. Instead we received numerous disinterested or wrong answers from staff who acted as if we were bothering them. This hotel was chosen because of the shuttle service as well as the Hyat name. While the facility and housekeeping staff were excellent the front desk staff was not a good representation of the Hyat brand. Individuals acted distracted. Even when there were no other guests waiting at the desk employees seemed annoyed that we were inquiring about the hotel shuttle. When we were told the shuttle was not available for various reasons on several days we were never given alternative means of transportation which we found out later would have rather easy to provide to us. Our impression was that the desk was short staffed and labeling the shuttle as unavailable was their way to compensate. These issues created a poor and stressful week. We are not the kind of people that typically complain formally or post reviews and create a public issue of our experience but this experience was awful. housekeeping was great it is a 20minute 25 dollar cab ride to the nearest subway station. If you are going into DC do not stay here. There is no shuttle service. front desk staff all appeared below 25 years old and not interested at all in their jobs or responsibilities.

The room the bed was extremely comfortable the linens or soft the room smells very clean and looked very cleanI did not like the hotel charging my credit card during the night I contacted the desk about the unauthorize use they did not know why I did not owe them anything they said the computer did it how many people got ripped off and just do not know. The hotel is a no smoking environment which I like there was a patron standing in the middle of the front steps smoking cigarettes and the smoke was coming in the lobby of the hotel it was horrible.

Good Value Clean Rooms. Overall acceptable experience we decided we had try other locations in the area next time we have to stay the weekend. Smell of gas in the lobby due to a cookout the hotel appeared to be mainly reserved for wedding parties receptions and other hotelcom guests. Lots of people at the front desk with complaints about the hotel claiming to have amenities it did not but we did not have that experience. The rooms were very clean the hotel soaps and lotions were a favorite high end brand of mine. The breakfast buffet was much better than similar hotels where all they offer is yogurt stale pastry and powdered eggs. Although we could have taken the complimentary shuttle we chose to walk the five minutes over to the local plaza with lots of chain restaurants like Blue Iguana and Joes Crab Shack.

Not worth 4 stars but ok since I did not pay full price I stayed here recently on a business trip for 2 nights. It was a Hotwire deal for a supposedly 4 star hotel. The staff was nice but short handed. The lobby and patio are gorgeous. I got an appetizer and a salad in the bar. Dip was ok the salad was one of the best dishes I have ever had. But then you go upstairs and it is like you walked into a 1980s Motel 6. Hallways are old and shabby. My room was clean but old and worn. And big but a really bizarre lay out. Double beds on opposite sides of the room. Only one side can see the TV not an issue since I was by myself but I can imagine families would not like it. Doors not very secure or safe speaking of being by myself. The bathroom had been updated but there is no fan so what was the point because it is getin moldy already on the ceiling. The fixtures were clean. Business center and WiFi not great. It was convenient to many things in Fairfax. It was fine for the Hotwire price I paid. I would stay here again if I absolutely had to or got the same rate as this time. But I would be mad if I was a guest who had paid full price expecting a four star experience with so many other options at a better price in the area.

The hotel lobby had sophisticated decor and since was during holidays it was beautifulying decorated with festive decor. The TV was poor quality maybe the connection and the channels were limited. The halls ways and rooms were a bit outdated in decor.

We just checked in and it has been a great experience here. The gentleman at the front desk was so polite and had wonderful customer service skills. The rooms and hotel look so beautiful. Location was great to stores. Had an issue with TV. but Jose showed up quick and resolved the issue in no time. The Maid lady was very nice and polite. We enjoyed the view from the 7th floor. This is our home away from home. We highly recommend this hotel.

Stingy. The hotels layout and rooms are great. We loved the modern ambience and cleaniles. However nothing is free at thia hotel. The house coffee and pay 4 per bottle is an absence of virtue. This is why I will never stay at a Hyat again.
Wonderful experience up to date clean hotel. Will be staying here my next stay in Fairfax.

One of the best hotel. Overall very much satisfied with the hotel and spacious rooms TV and Internet services along with friendly staff. It was a nice experience and I recommend my friends and family to choose this hotel for their stay.
Clean quiet and friendly. The checkin experience was easy and pleasant. No.
Excellent Experience. Had an amazing experience at the Hyat will stay again.

Nice stay. The room setting was nice and comfortable and the king size bed was nicely made with soft linens during my stay. The bathroom was clean and the tiny make up mirror was a wonderful addition I reraly found in many hotels I stayed in past years. We hope one day the L shape sofa will be reupholstered with softer fabric. We will stay at the Hyat Fairfax again.

Great location for running Burke Lake Park Trails. This Hyat was perfect for me. My room was clean and very comfortable. Check in and check out went smoothly and I had no issues. The front desk recommended a great restaurant for dinner which was a little pricey but it was truly delicious Texas de Brazil. I chose this location due to running a 10 K rave at Burke Lake Park and wanting a hotel that has high standards. I had a nice experience and woke feeling refreshed. Nice job Hyat.

Love Hyat. The rooms are amazing clean comfortable and with beautiful views. The staff are respectful and professional and always taking care of clients needs. Love it that it ’s pet friendly and it has two patios to sit and enjoy with the dogs and has a lot of grass in the surroundings. The food is AMAZING. I would totally recommend this hotel.
